text: In a 1-year-old girl, born of nonconsanguineous parents of Indian origin, who had massive excretion of 5-oxoproline in urine but no symptoms related to glutathione cycle defects, Calpena et al. (2013) identified heterozygosity for a 969C-A transversion in the OPLAH gene, resulting in a ser323-to-arg (S323R) substitution at a highly conserved residue in the first domain, near an ATP-binding site. The presence of a large deletion or duplication was excluded by gel electrophoresis. The patient's asymptomatic mother was also heterozygous for the mutation, which was not found in her father or in 128 controls.
